definitions.definition: An act performed for amusement; a joke.
Someone or something that is ridiculed; the target of a joke.
definitions.example: Your majesty, stop him before he makes you the jest of the court.

definitions.definition: A deed; an action; a gest.
A mask; a pageant; an interlude.
To tell a joke; to talk in a playful manner; to make fun of something or someone.

definitions.example: He calls it vermilion, but it's just red to me.

definitions.definition: (sentence adverb) Used to reduce the force of an imperative; simply.
definitions.example: Just follow the directions on the box.

definitions.definition: Used to convey a less serious or formal tone

definitions.example: Lord, we just want to thank You and praise Your Name.
They just left, but you may leave a message at the desk.

definitions.definition: By a narrow margin; closely; nearly.
definitions.example: The fastball just missed my head!
He wants everything just right for the big day.
